snippet.title: Thirroul reserve to become pop-up skate park
snippet.content:
Local crew: James Brown (left), 8, and Sam Beadman, 6, lead a group lobbying for a Thirroul skate park. Picture: KIRK GILMOUR Skateboards are set to take over Thirroul Beach Reserve on Saturday as dozens of keen boardriders show off their moves at a pop-up skate park.
The park, organised by the Northern Illawarra Skateboarders Alliance, is a free event aimed at raising awareness of the need for a permanent skate park in the area. The skate park will run from 10am to 4pm and will include a DJ, a sausage sizzle and a skate clinic for beginners.
